intro: Lotononis serpens, commonly known as the snake's head plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its long, trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. It is often grown as a decorative plant in gardens and containers due to its ornamental value. Lotononis serpens is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade.
